column3: Please update doc/dependencies to gcc 8 (from 7), as std::fs is not included in gcc 7\n\nEdit: And clang-7
Updated. I am not sure if this PR shouldn't be put on hold until CentOS 23 starts shipping with a recent enough compiler?
Maybe adding `-lstdc++fs` to the build flags via configure by default fixes the compile errors?

Concept ACK! That's another WIN32 specific hack less.

But yes it's probably going to be a looong time before this can be merged.
I will leave this as is (open, with failing CI) until the compilers we support catch up with C++17 filesystem support.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
Removed the changes to `doc/dependencies.md` as those will be carried by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20460 (bumping minimum compiler version requirements), also they caused conflicts.

:>Removed the changes to doc/dependencies.md as those will be carried by #20460 (bumping minimum compiler version requirements), also they caused conflicts.\n\nYou should probably rebase this PR on top of that then...
@luke-jr that's right, but #20460 is just an issue/idea, without a patch (yet)...
> I will leave this as is (open, with failing CI) until the compilers we support catch up with C++17 filesystem support.\n\nI don't think labeling this as "waiting for author" is quite right.
This pull is waiting for the author to rebase on the pull that fixes #20460  . Is there a better label?
There is no fix for the issue #20460 yet.\n\nThis PR is waiting for newer compilers to hit the `master` branch (docs and ci).
> There is no fix for the issue #20460 yet.\n\nIf you want, you can now rebase on top of #20744.
> If you want, you can now rebase on top of #20744.\n\nI think a rebase is not (strictly) needed, just a (force) push to re-trigger CI.
> I think a rebase is not (strictly) needed, just a (force) push to re-trigger CI.\n\nSure, but this can't be merged before #20744 in any case.

`166b1542d7...99b151df9c`: rebase

> This PR is waiting for newer compilers to hit the `master` branch

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23060 did just that (merged).

I don't think this PR depends on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20744. @fanquake, why do you think this PR cannot be merged before https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20744?

> I don't think this PR depends on #20744. @fanquake, why do you think this PR cannot be merged before #20744?\n\nBecause we are either using `boost::filesystem` or `std::filesystem`. We're not going to have the repo exist in some awkward middle ground where we are using both. In any case, using `std::filesystem` is not necessarily straight forward, and likely requires the changes in #22937 befo

Another reason is that this doesn't have any build system support for properly using `std::filesystem`, and the additional linker flags that may be needed, i.e https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20744/commits/721928821f1623265db9c07f2fcef49a356d477f.

`99b151df9c...a9ab42ca97`: rebase due to conflicts and pick up a suggestion.

This now depends on #20744 in two ways:
* Build system changes to make it compile on all platforms
* Assumes that our custom `fs::path` is `std::filesystem::path` (passes a variable of type `fs::path` to `std::filesystem::rename()`).

Invalidates ACK from @ryanofsky (conditional)
Shouldn't doxygen be in the `.h` file?
Right, moved.

In commit "util: use stronger-guarantee rename method" (99b151df9c074f60150c5eb777ed98bfd7118e91)

This will result in narrow string conversion on windows, and after #22937 will be a compiler error. Should be easy to fix by changing to:

```c++
std::filesystem::rename(src.native(), dest.native(), error);
```

This should also work after #20744, but after #20744 it could be simplifi
Used just `src` and `dest`, thanks!
